Four Tips for a Leisurely Beach Day | Bon Appétit

So when the day finally comes to loll on a blanket under the sun, you want to make the most of it. With a few essentials on hand, you can simplify your experience and extend your time on the shore. So what’s it going to take to keep you situated in the sand fuss-free? We’ve got you covered.Be BasicThis may seem like a no-brainer, but when you’re packing your beach bag, start with the basics. First: SPF. You’ll want at least 30 if you’re planning to spend the day along the shore. A beach hat would be advisable, as it goes above and beyond (literally) your sunnies for more protection. Next, throw in a water bottle for all-day hydration, a good book you’ve been waiting to devour, and a beach blanket. But forget the standard towel—opt for a big summery blanket that fits a friend (or two).Snack SmartRepeat after me: Do not go to the beach hungry. Aside from risking a Hulk-like rage on a beach umbrella, hunger will also cut your beach day short. Pack easy, refreshing snacks like watermelon in a sealed container. Melon has high water content, so it doubles as a juicy and delicious hydrator while you’re sweating it out in the sun.For a more filling and savory snack, new Stacy’s® Cheese Petites come in Romano with Garlic and Pepper, and Parmesan with Rosemary–and each have six grams of protein per serving. Their snackable nature is due to the fact that cheese is the first and foremost ingredient (because cheese), and it doesn’t hurt that you can grab a handful, pass it around, and easily reseal it with no fuss or clean up. Want that cheesy deliciousness on hand all the time, even when you’re not at the beach? For a limited time, head over to stacyssnacks.com for a 20% off promo code.Go Beyond H2OYou could crack open a seltzer, but why not make it a little Self-Care Saturday? (You’re already getting your weekly dose of vitamin D.) We like the fizzy, probiotic-packed boost of kombucha. Think of it as a thumbs-up for your gut, which is kind of like the control center for your body. A good ‘buch can aid in digestion, ease inflammation, and, if consumed over time, help ward off disease. So drink up!We're SpritzingYou’re bathing in the sun. You’re glistening from joy and also heat. You’re dominating beach time with snacks and SPF. But there’s one last thing that’s going to make you a refreshment renegade: rosewater face mist. Rosewater has soothing, anti-inflammatory properties, and is also great at removing oil and dirt (which can accumulate as you sweat). Plus, it’s oh-so refreshing when you need a quick beach boost.Recipes you want to make. Cooking advice that works.
